[https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198003043978](https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198003043978)

1. Could be better, could be much worse.
2. I am living alone with my cat.
3. Dark green, there is probably a word for it but I am a simple guy, so I have no idea.
4. Why not both? I live in a small studio apartment, but I would definietly have a dog alongside my cat, if I lived in a fenced house.
5. A little bit miserable, my mother is a nurse and she works with COVID patients so I am worried.
6. Not much has changed in my everyday life, since I have always been a loner, my work hours have been severly cut, it is tough but a lot of others have it much worse.
7. Digital sessions all the way! I have the social aptitude of a handful of dead butterflies, the less I interact with people personally, the less I embarass myself.
8. [https://www.youtube.com/user/TheWolfePit](https://www.youtube.com/user/TheWolfePit) This dude cooks and reviews horrible frozed ready to eat meals, I don't know what I find so addicting in the latter.
9. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GI7sBsBHdCk](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GI7sBsBHdCk) This describes the clown world we are living in perfectly
10. My go to snack is chewing gums.
11. It has been more than 3 months, since I had a beer with my friends, I am not a party animal, but I am really starting to miss a good night out in the town.
12. Xcom EW with long war mod right now, also new Xcom spinoff is releasing withing a week, so I am excited about it, I love the series.
13. I don't watch anything currently.
14. Learbed how to cook minute rice in 57 seconds.
15. Xcom Chimera Squad wohooo!!! I am on my way snek waifu!!!
16. [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aDNXVHvo-yM](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aDNXVHvo-yM)
17. I get a weird satisfaction from couponing and buying groceries at a discount, no, I am not a middle aged wife.
18. Same answer as to 1. Could be better, could be much worse.
19. Gaming is my lifeblood, especially nowadays.
20. I am REALLY hoping, that underpaid healthcare workers like my mother, will recieve better treatment from society, than they do nowadays.
21. Did I mention Xcom: Chimera Squad? The remaining funds would be spent on some incredibly embarassing hentai game, that I would try to hide from my library after playing it.
Thanks OP!

[https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198003043978](https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198003043978)

Stealth is key in an all out battle royale, so I would definietly go with a pokemon, which can turn invisible. It has been ages since I last watched the anime, but I remember Haunter was able to turn invisible, he could just go invisible at the beginning of the match and wait in the sidelines until only one other opponent left, then he can ambush the other one, who is probably exhausted, and take an easy and really scummy win.
So how do I deal with turn 6 Nerea? Oh wait, I play shadow so I instantly lose, great expansion.

My game would be Mount and blade: Bannerlord

​

I could sing you an aria

About my  lands in Caldaria

Where butter flows free and proud

Despair! My fief was raided by a lout!

Fuck this game! I am out!

​

I could tell you about Bannerlord

A game ancient times foretold

Where simps are many, Vlandians at the ready

Beware! My axe is heavy, true and steady

Heads will roll, bloody and fleshy
Holy shit OP, reading your story almost gave me an anxiety attack, can't say anything that would help you unfortunetly but I wish you and your girlfriend all the luck, you both definietly need it.

People do not understand it, because most have never been there, self preservation is such an ingrained instinct, it takes incredible amount of pain for someone to override it and actually do the deed.

Did he cause pain to his family and loved ones?

He most certainly did.

Can we expect someone, whos life became pure hell to endure it for the rest of his life, just so the family can avoid the grief his loss will cause?

I do not think so.

I would argue, the real piece of shit here is a society, which still refuses to give people the right to end their life with dignity, instead of forcing them to blow their brains out or jump out of the window of a high rise building.

Thanks OP!

Here is a fun fact for you: There is this substance called ambergris, which is basically one of the substance that is found in sperm whale (I know...) puke, this substance is incredibly expensive, and it is mainly used to produce pricy perfumes/fragances, because as it ages, it acquires a "sweet, earthy" smell. It was also historically used as an incredibly expensive delicacy, it is said that ambergris with a side of eggs was among the favorite dishes of King Charles II of England.
I highly recommend Westworld, if you haven't watched it by chance

Service industry, I am a waiter, 2 weeks ago the goverment shut down all restaurants where I live, so I got laid off for the time being.
Don't need help thankfully, I got some savings enough for 4 months of living expenses, and do not have any debt, so I am already better off than a lot of people who are in the same shoes as me, hopefully the virus will end, or at least recede enough so I can get back to work soon. In the meantime, I am doing the occasionally freelance translations or things like that, it brings in a little bit of money, 200 euro a month is still better than nothing, helps me keep afloat longer.

I don't want the normies to feel as we do. It is a curse enough, that we are like this, I do not wish it upon those who can lead socially fulfilling lives. True enough, I get jealous of them a lot of times, but it is not their fault, that I am like this, so why harbour ill will towards them? It would just make me a more bitter person than I already am.

27/m in similar shoes. Even worse, I can't even find a rational reason behind why I am like this, I was never bullied harshly, never experienced poverty or any such crippling event, that would explain why I am emotionally stunted like this. Ironically, I feel lonely a lot of the time but I just can't force myself to go out and try to connect with people.

[https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198003043978](https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198003043978)

My absolute favorite game is really hard to pick, since I have a lot, but one of the most influental game I ever played was Xcom: Enemy Unknown and Xcom 2. Enemy Unknown was my first ever Xcom game, in introduced me to the franchise and cemented my love for turn based tactical games. Xcom 2 basically is an improved version of enemy unknown and it basically fixed my only problem with the game, it has semi random maps now so replayability is ensured. I also played the old Xcom games since then and loved it (but holy hell terror from the deep is HARD). Btw if you are by chance also an Xcom fan, check out Xenonauts, it is an Xcom clone but an actually good one.

I want Synthetik: Legion Rising mainly because it is a roguelike, the combat system looks fun and tactically deep, and a famous african warlord gave it his recommendation, so that is gold to me (hey hey people)

You continue is impress with your generosity, thanks again!

I would love any of the following games:

1: Metro Redux Bundle

2:  S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat

3:  S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky

4:  S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl

5:  Warhammer: End Times - Vermintide

I would love the Stalker franchise, because I purchased Escape from Tarkov half a year ago and had incredible fun with it. Many people told me that the game is incredibly similar to the Stalker games, just without the multiplayer part, and told me that based on my enjoyment of Tarkov, I would probably love any of the Stalker games. They also told me that I should definietly check out mods for them, because it makes the games even better. Watched the trailers on stream and the game indeed looked fun, looks like it has a sci fi twist in it unlike Tarkov, definietly piqued my interest

I am interested in Vermintide, because I am an avid blood bowl fan, which is basically a board game that is taking place in the same universe as Warhammer, I would love to play a non goofy game in the same universe and immerse myself in the lore (people say it is vast) Also read that it is a melee fighting game with a focus on coop, I played a lot of Chivalry: medieval warfare, and more recently, getting my arse kicked in Mordhau, so I am always interested in melee games.

Thanks again for the chance!

My favorite game is Kingdom Come: Deliverance, It is a historically accurate open world RPG without (thankfully) any fantasy element, you also play as a good for nothing peasant, since you are a common blacksmith, you suck at swordfight, archery, heck, you can't even read at the beginning of the game, every time you level up, you become slightly better and it feels amazing to see Henry slowly become better and better at doing everything. The combat is also excellent and harsh (playing the game on hardcore is a must IMO) you WILL get your arse kicked at the beginning, and being outnumbered is almost a certain death sentence.

All in all, if you like open world RPGs and tired of the fantasy tropes, Kingdom Come will not disappoint you

I was about 8 years old on a cruise with my family, my father repeatedly told me not to flail my legs over the rails because I will lose my sandals, I ignored his warnings every time and just as he said, promtly managed to lose my sandals to the sea within 10 minutes.

The fun truly began when the ship docked at a small, almost uninhabited island for some free time, the island only had trails made out of pebbles for tourists to follow, and it hurt like hell to walk on. After a couple of minutes my father couldn't bear to listen to my whining any longer and gave his sandals to me and proceeded to spend the rest of our time on the island walking on the pebbles bare footed, cursing and getting laughed at by the other tourists and my family.

Almost 20 years have passed since then and my family still brings up this story every summer when I go meet them.
